Spingou, ‘Πῶς δεῖ εὑρίσκειν τὸ δακτύλιον: Byzantine game or a problem from Fibonacci’s Liber Abaci?’ Byzantion 84 (2014) 357–369. (esp. 358, 359, 362). (hand 3)

handDesc.handNote: One hand throughout, though fols 90–128r possibly in a second hand. A third later hand on fols 173v-174r.

decoDesc.decoNote: fol. 158v: small decorative head-piece in carmine red ink, indicating new section.

binding.p: Typical Holkham binding of brown leather, with Coke family ostrich crest in gilt in the centre of the upper cover; date: early nineteenth century. Rebound by John Jones of Liverpool (worked for Holkham 1816–1823). The spine lettered in gilt: / EXCEPTA (sic)/ EX/ APOSTOLIS/ET / PATRIBUS/ &c./; in pasted black leather: MS. /HOLKHAM/ Gr.55 /
